column4: ai karamba... no one can help me identify what codec i requires to make my divx / avi films play in Feisty?
.... and so many gurus here....*sigh*
spelled your name wrong, whoops
you might try installing vlc and seeing if it will play it, if you haven't already
i'm curious now to identify the particular avi that is missing though... I
could you pastebin the output of mplayer -identify on one of the files that doesn't work?
i just click on the file and i think Totem opens . What output where?
from a terminal. you might have to install mplayer as well. Alternatively, you could just install every codec you can find
theres a bunch of different codecs for avis
i see them now and i gonna install ALL of them...
well it can tell you the info you need to find out what codec you need
should i instll mplayer then so i can identify outpput?
it's an option. or just install all the codecs.
ok, i install all the codecs first
got no clue. try this: http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu:Feisty#How_to_install_Multimedia_Codecs
that's because vlc  uses it's own codecs . .. kinda.
http://www.ubuntugeek.com/install-mplayer-and-multimedia-codecs-libdvdcss2w32codecs-in-ubuntu-feisty-fawn.html first on google for w32codecs ubuntu feisty

check it out... Totem playes it now... despite installing all the codecs it wasn't working... this intrigued me... i installed totem-xine which replaced gstreameer and now it works too. So now Totem works and VLC
yes, that's because you're using a different engine, that uses different codecs
so it wasn't the codecs that were the issue perhaps but the engine i needed to switch ovwer to
it's a bit complicated. google and read if you want to understand the whole engine/codec/playing videos thing
